response_parsed.title: Type Checking Edge Runtimes with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to utilize FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, to enforce type checking on edge runtimes.
key_points: Install FastAPI and its dependencies using `pip install fastapi[all]`
Create a new FastAPI application using the `FastAPI` class
Define your endpoints with their expected input types using FastAPI's annotations
Use the `Pydantic` models to validate and type-check incoming requests
Handle exceptions for invalid inputs and return informative error messages
Utilize Python 3.12+ features like Type Hints, Variadic Type Hints, and Union Types within your FastAPI app

code_examples.code:
from typing import Union
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException

app = FastAPI()

class Item(BaseModel):
    name: str
    description: Union[str, None]
    price: Union[float, int]

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for utilizing some of the latest type hinting features
FastAPI v0.70.0 or later supports Python 3.12 with some improvements on performance and additional features
caveats: Make sure to handle edge cases where user input may not match expected types
Consider using external libraries like `pydantic-utils` for more advanced type validation
Ensure that your application is secure by sanitizing and validating all user inputs
